documentType: evidence log / chain of custody form
summary: This document is an evidence log and chain of custody form for a box of seized items related to case 31E-MM-108062. The box contains multiple VHS tapes, DVD-R discs, micro cassettes, and a CD, primarily from the Palm Beach Police Department (PBPD) and Palm Beach Sheriff's Office (PBSO) from 2005-2006. The evidence was collected on August 28, 2006, and the log was finalized on July 20, 2021.

events.title: Evidence Collection/Acquisition
events.description: Items were migrated/collected as part of case 31E-MM-108062. The holding office was initially Miami (MM).

events.title: Evidence Log Finalized
events.description: The FD-1087 evidence log was finalized, indicating a recent inventory or administrative action on the long-held evidence.

locations: MM - MIAMI (Initial Holding Office from Acquisition)
keyFacts: A significant box of physical evidence was seized on or before August 28, 2006, under case ID 31E-MM-108062, which is likely related to the initial Palm Beach investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

The evidence includes at least 19 items: 7 VHS tapes of surveillance, 16 DVD-R discs, a Cingular Wireless envelope with subpoena info, a Cingular Wireless CD, 6 Sony micro cassettes, a 1-160 video cassette, a CD, and a green folder, all labeled with PBPD or PBSO case numbers from 2005 and 2006.
The evidence was held by the Miami office initially and was stored in New York as of the log's finalization in 2021, showing interstate handling of the case materials.
The chain of custody forms (FD-192) are incomplete, with many signature, name, and date fields blank or illegible, though one note indicates 'WEAPONS CHECKED & CLEARED BY FIREARMS INSTRUCTOR'.

The document references specific police case numbers (e.g., PBPD 05-1205, PBPD 05-1219) which are likely the original Palm Beach Police Department investigation files that formed part of the federal evidence.
